p.d: 1999. Victor is an architect and lives with Serge, already HIV positive for several years. Whilst working on a major project he finds himself face-to-face with Sélim, site foreman, like his father. Although their attraction remains unchanged, Sélim is now married and a father. Their secret affair has made Victor realise he would like to start a family and persuades Serge to adopt child, but for homosexual couples adoption is virtually impossible... Directed by: Philippe Faucon (France, 2017) Screenplay: José Caltagirone, Niels Rahou, Philippe Faucon Cast: Samuel Theis (Victor), Stanislas Nordey (Serge), Frédéric Pierrot (Charles), Nicolas Cazalé (Sélim), Rebecca Marder (Noémie), Sophie Quinton (Aurélie), Phénix Brossard (Basile, 17 years old), Loubna Abidar (Farah), Leila Fournier (Lydie), Lyla Mansouri Asselain (LeIla), Mehdi Touré (Cédric), Emmanuelle Bercot (Martine), Chiara Mastroianni (the social worker) Genre: comedy drama Awards: prize for the best series at the 2018 Luchon Festival for Audiovisual Creation
